base64-string.title: Base64 string
base64-string.description: A base64 encoded string used to describe binary data.

initiatingRequestPattern.description: Pattern to match the request that initiated the channel

oneOf.description: Target channels initiated by requests matching a pattern

delay-distribution.description: The delay distribution. Valid property configuration is either median/sigma/type or lower/type/upper.

oneOf.title: Log normal
oneOf.description: Log normal randomly distributed response delay.
A JSON-encoded JSON string to match.

message.description: Longer message regarding the status of the server

uptimeInSeconds.description: How long the server has been running

initiatingRequest.description: The HTTP request that initiated the channel (for request-initiated channels)

open.description: Whether the channel is currently open

id.description: The unique identifier for this request

url.description: The path and query to match exactly against

absoluteUrl.description: The full URL to match against

host.description: The host part of the URL

browserProxyRequest.description: Whether this request was made via a browser proxy

loggedDate.description: The timestamp when the request was logged (epoch millis)

loggedDateString.description: The formatted date string when the request was logged

queryParams.description: Query parameters parsed from the URL

formParams.description: Form parameters parsed from the request body

name.description: The name of the multipart part

fileName.description: The filename of the multipart part, if provided

body.description: The body content of this part

bodyAsBase64.description: Base64 encoded body content of this part

matchesJsonSchema.description: A valid JSON schema as a string

schemaVersion.description: The JSON schema version to interpret the schema against

message-action.description: Action to perform when a message stub is triggered

transformers.description: List of transformer names to apply to the message

message-definition.description: Definition of a message to be sent

channel.description: Pattern to match the channel's initiating request

body.description: Pattern to match the message body

message-serve-event.description: A message event logged in the journal

id.description: Unique identifier for this message event

eventType.description: Whether the message was received or sent

channelId.description: ID of the channel on which the message was sent/received

channelRequest.description: The HTTP request that initiated the channel (for request-initiated channels)

message.description: The message body as a string

stubMapping.description: The message stub mapping that was matched (if any)

wasMatched.description: Whether this message matched a stub mapping

subEvents.description: Sub-events that occurred during message processing

relativeTiming.description: Timing in nanoseconds relative to the start of the event

messageJournalDisabled.description: Whether the message journal is disabled

message-stub-mapping.description: A message stub mapping defines how WireMock responds to messages on channels

id.description: This message stub mapping's unique identifier

priority.description: This message stub mapping's priority relative to others. 1 is highest.

actions.description: Actions to perform when this stub is triggered

metadata.description: Arbitrary metadata to be attached to the stub mapping

message-stub-mappings.description: A collection of message stub mappings

total.description: Total number of message stub mappings

oneOf.description: Trigger when a specific HTTP stub is matched

stubId.description: The ID of the HTTP stub mapping that triggers this message stub

oneOf.description: Trigger when an HTTP request matches a pattern

message-verification-result.description: Result of a message verification operation

count.description: Number of messages matching the criteria

messageJournalDisabled.description: Whether the message journal is disabled

captureHeaders.description: Headers from the request to include in the generated stub mappings, mapped to parameter objects. The only parameter available is "caseInsensitive", which defaults to false

extractBodyCriteria.description: Criteria for extracting response bodies to a separate file instead of including it in the stub mapping

binarySizeThreshold.description: Size threshold for extracting binary response bodies. Supports humanized size strings, e.g. "56 Mb". Default unit is bytes.

textSizeThreshold.description: Size threshold for extracting binary response bodies. Supports humanized size strings, e.g. "56 Mb". Default unit is bytes.

persist.description: Whether to save stub mappings to the file system or just return them

repeatsAsScenarios.description: When true, duplicate requests will be added to a Scenario. When false, duplicates are discarded

requestBodyPattern.description: Control the request body matcher used in generated stub mappings

oneOf.description: Automatically determine matcher based on content type (the default)

caseInsensitive.description: If equalTo is used, match body use case-insensitive string comparison

ignoreArrayOrder.description: If equalToJson is used, ignore order of array elements

ignoreExtraElements.description: If equalToJson is used, matcher ignores extra elements in objects

oneOf.description: Always match request bodies using equalTo

caseInsensitive.description: Match body using case-insensitive string comparison

oneOf.description: Always match request bodies using equalToJson
Always match request bodies using equalToXml

transformerParameters.description: List of names of stub mappings transformers to apply to generated stubs

transformers.description: Parameters to pass to stub mapping transformers

scheme.description: The scheme (protocol) part of the request URL

host.description: The hostname part of the request URL

port.description: The HTTP port number of the request URL

oneOf.description: The HTTP request method e.g. GET

url.description: The path and query to match exactly against. Only one of url, urlPattern, urlPath or urlPathPattern may be specified.

urlPath.description: The path to match exactly against. Only one of url, urlPattern, urlPath or urlPathPattern may be specified.

urlPathPattern.description: The path regex to match against. Only one of url, urlPattern, urlPath or urlPathPattern may be specified.

urlPattern.description: The path and query regex to match against. Only one of url, urlPattern, urlPath or urlPathPattern may be specified.

urlPathTemplate.description:
The path template to match against. Must conform to the OpenAPI compatible subset of the RFC 6570 URI Template specification.
Only one of url, urlPattern, urlPath or urlPathPattern may be specified.

pathParameters.description:
Path parameter patterns to match against in the <key>: { "<predicate>": "<value>" } form. Can only
be used when the urlPathPattern URL match type is in use and all keys must be present as variables
in the path template.

queryParameters.description: Query parameter patterns to match against in the <key>: { "<predicate>": "<value>" } form

formParameters.description: application/x-www-form-urlencoded form parameter patterns to match against in the <key>: { "<predicate>": "<value>" } form

headers.description: Header patterns to match against in the <key>: { "<predicate>": "<value>" } form

clientIp.description: The client IP address to match against

basicAuthCredentials.description: Pre-emptive basic auth credentials to match against

cookies.description: Cookie patterns to match against in the <key>: { "<predicate>": "<value>" } form

bodyPatterns.description: Request body patterns to match against in the { "<predicate>": "<value>" } form

customMatcher.description: Custom request matcher to match against

name.description: The matcher's name specified in the implementation of the matcher.

multipartPatterns.description: Multipart patterns to match against headers and body.

matchingType.description: Determines whether all or any of the parts must match the criteria for an overall match.

headers.description: Header patterns to match against in the <key>: { "<predicate>": "<value>" } form

bodyPatterns.description: Body patterns to match against in the { "<predicate>": "<value>" } form

status.description: The HTTP status code to be returned

statusMessage.description: The HTTP status message to be returned

headers.description: Map of response headers to send

additionalProxyRequestHeaders.description: Extra request headers to send when proxying to another host.

removeProxyRequestHeaders.description: Request headers to remove when proxying to another host.

body.description: The response body as a string. Only one of body, base64Body, jsonBody or bodyFileName may be specified.

jsonBody.description: The response body as a JSON object. Only one of body, base64Body, jsonBody or bodyFileName may be specified.

bodyFileName.description: The path to the file containing the response body, relative to the configured file root. Only one of body, base64Body, jsonBody or bodyFileName may be specified.

fault.description: The fault to apply (instead of a full, valid response).

fixedDelayMilliseconds.description: Number of milliseconds to delay be before sending the response.

chunkedDribbleDelay.description: The parameters for chunked dribble delay - chopping the response into pieces and sending them at delayed intervals

fromConfiguredStub.description: Read-only flag indicating false if this was the default, unmatched response. Not present otherwise.

proxyBaseUrl.description: The base URL of the target to proxy matching requests to.

proxyUrlPrefixToRemove.description: A path segment to remove from the beginning in incoming request URL paths before proxying to the target.

transformerParameters.description: Parameters to apply to response transformers.

transformers.description: List of names of transformers to apply to this response.

items.description: All the states this scenario can be in

state.description: The current state of this scenario

send-channel-message-request.description: Request to send a message to channels

initiatingRequest.description: Pattern to match the initiating request of target channels

send-channel-message-result.description: Result of sending a message to channels

channelsMessaged.description: Number of channels that received the message

single-message-serve-event-result.description: Result containing a single message serve event

item.description: The message serve event, or null if not found

persistent.description: Indicates that the stub mapping should be persisted immediately on create/update/delete and survive resets to default.

priority.description: This stub mapping's priority relative to others. 1 is highest.

scenarioName.description: The name of the scenario that this stub mapping is part of

requiredScenarioState.description: The required state of the scenario in order for this stub to be matched.

newScenarioState.description: The new state for the scenario to be updated to after this stub is served.

postServeActions.description:
DEPRECATED: Use `serveEventListeners` instead.
A map of the names of post serve action extensions to trigger and their parameters.

serveEventListeners.description: The list of serve event listeners

metadata.description: Arbitrary metadata to be used for e.g. tagging, documentation. Can also be used to find and remove stubs.

wait-for-message-request.description: Request to wait for message events

timeoutMillis.description: Maximum time to wait in milliseconds

count.description: Number of messages to wait for (for wait-for-count endpoint)
